Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that "not even old Gen. Eisenhower... had saluted military personnel" as president, when there is evidence that Eisenhower did salute military personnel.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Eisenhower did salute military personnel as president.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is contradicted by evidence of Eisenhower saluting military personnel.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that Eisenhower did salute military personnel as president.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it does not accurately represent the actions of Eisenhower.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Eisenhower did not salute military personnel as president.
Understate: The claim understates the actions of Eisenhower by suggesting that he did not salute military personnel as president, when there is evidence to the contrary.
